page.title: 01OLD SYMINGTON
page.content:
Symington is a small village situated just off the Ayr-Kilmarnock Road(A77) The population is approximately . The restored church dating back to the 12th Century,has a trio of round headed windows and an ancient roof of open work timber.This medieval church building remains intact and still in use.It has of course been altered and changed to suit Protestant purposes. The name Symington is derived from Simon Loccard who is said to have founded the church. Many of the local place names derive from old estate names e.g.,{ {Dankeith,Rosemount,Townend,Whitehill, {Craigie,Knockendale and Whitelees.
